text: In this @VarineTrib @TribLIVE piece I’m quoted about hospitalization metrics for #COVID19 being the best gauge as the goal is to shift infection to the mild spectrum https://t.co/PkIs8Iio20

In this TV interview with @EvanLambertTV I discuss additional #COVID19 booster vaccine doses — these should be targeted to people who are at risk for severe disease (not universal) https://t.co/sR22PU1qwc
In this television interview I discuss some aspects of the BA.2 Omicron #COVID19 variant https://t.co/SmzU5P7Is3

In this piece I’m quoted about the #COVID19 mask mandate the government has in place. This doesn’t make sense when many higher risk, less well ventilated activities are mask free. Flying is probably one of the lowest risk #COVID19 activities https://t.co/ykMJs6YPm2
At about 8:20 PM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @ManginoOnKDKAAM on @KDKARadio. Listen live here: https://t.co/tvdwdUDhOq

In this @Lecia_Bushak piece I am quoted about public health infrastructure being perennially inadequate to the task, hence #COVID19’s impact. This is something that the government should be held accountable for https://t.co/z9crw1Uywk

In this @JamieSmythF piece I’m quoted about  #COVID19 booster strategies—it’s not optimal to continue to boost w/ original strain to prevent mild illness in the healthy.  High risk should be boosted, Original antigenic sin should be studied as well https://t.co/j3bIdRpnG5

In this @mikeerman1 piece I am quoted about the Moderna #COVID19 vaccine results in children below 6 — the data looks good and the efficacy results have to be interpreted in the context of Omicron https://t.co/zn6hE3ClkE

In this TV interview I discuss the BA.2 #COVID19 Omicron variant and what its impact might be. I don’t think the US will see major issues in hospitals because of the immunity in the population and the tools we know have https://t.co/pjrhjz7K9h

In this piece I offer my perspective on the CDC #COVID19 data — it should be published immediately and the CDC has the ability to provide nuanced communication to help facilitate interpretation https://t.co/ir28xmzGpQ

“The..pandemic was associated w/ conditions that likely contributed to risk-associated increased HD & stroke mortality..periods of overcrowding of hospitals..fewer visits for medical care, poorer medication adherence, &..barriers to healthy lifestyle” https://t.co/kA9XpFnPN8
“Led mainly by surges in Asian hot spots, COVID-19 cases last week increased for the second straight week, though deaths continued to fall” https://t.co/JXth9BbrKy

"Remote monitoring reduced unnecessary contact of health-care professionals with patients with COVID-19, which could control the risk of infection transmission and enable resources to be redirected to those who need them the most” https://t.co/jjttLWr5Qd

"It is also important to know that, in the event of a future pandemic, we have a tested method of risk-assessing patients and providing healthcare while minimizing healthcare worker exposures” https://t.co/LjtzQE3N9m

“Over one-third of patients with severe COVID-19 had ophthalmological manifestations. The most frequent fundoscopic findings were optic nerve inflammation, microvasculature occlusion and major vascular occlusions.” https://t.co/bzWJlFnBr4
In this TV interview I discuss the BA.2 Omicron #COVID19 variant, the trajectory of the pandemic, and hospital capacity https://t.co/6Vk8PdDLpy
In this @nicolekarlis piece I am quoted about 4th #COVID19 doses which I think make sense in the high risk population, not everyone https://t.co/r5ELqS8FWB
At about 9 AM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 on Bloomberg @Quicktake. Watch live here https://t.co/sY3Eo6oVO6
In this television interview with @kaileyleinz I discuss the BA.2 version of the #COVID19 Omicron variant (36:28 mark) https://t.co/jpskeguR0x
In this @TheRobertHart piece I am quoted about the current trajectory of #COVID19 and booster vaccine doses https://t.co/11QrcP1ioF

“All of the vaccines authorized for use in the United States against Covid-19 do an excellent job at keeping people out of hospitals and alive. Even just two doses of the mRNA vaccines are very effective”
In this interview with @ItsAlexOnTV, recorded 3/21/22, I discuss the BA.2 Omicron #COVID19 variant and other related topics https://t.co/VRSYu3I7qX

RT @genevievefri: Will everyone -- even healthy young people -- need a second COVID booster soon? 

Not so fast, says @AmeshAA. First, let'…

“One weird finding that nobody could explain was a slight difference between the Covid and control groups in the scans taken before the pandemic — the Covid patients actually started with smaller brains.” https://t.co/Z8XabDMFDV

In this podcast I discuss the concept of “Disease X” and how to proactively prepare for respiratory viral families most likely to be responsible for future pandemics with @drJoshS and @anita_cicero https://t.co/z3RWiek85x

In this @medpagetoday piece I argue that 4th #COVID19 vaccine doses are (like 3rd doses) should not be universal but targeted to high risk individuals. The goal — with current vaccines — is prevention of severe disease, not all cases https://t.co/vFzrdT625Z
At about 9:27 AM eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 with @ItsAlexOnTV on @Newsy. Watch live here https://t.co/23FQK5DBqp

“The prevalence of COVID-19 among pwCF in NY during the pandemic first wave was low and most cases were managed at home. CFTR modulators may be protective. PwCF experienced delay in routine care and increased anxiety.” https://t.co/QWnjTWWMfi

In this piece I’m quoted about how most #COVID19 treatments are only available via EUA with the government as sole purchaser/distributor. Until the govt allows a commercial market (there always should have been one), funds to purchase these products neede https://t.co/QfoXnxJS25
In this video interview I discuss multiple facets of the #COVID19 pandemic https://t.co/3YfZYsDwf2
At about 7:20 pm eastern I’ll be discussing the latest on #COVID19 on @KDKARadio with @ManginoOnKDKAAM. Listen live here https://t.co/tvdwdUlGWS

In this @Pien_Huang piece I’m quoted about the underutilization of #COVID19 medications. Awareness needs to increase but is difficult because pharmaceutical companies can’t effectively promote them while under EUA https://t.co/nInhQOyY3U
In this piece I’m quoted about how #COVID19 exposures are becoming less concerning and can be managed much more adeptly with the tools we now have https://t.co/IsKEFj5cgy

In this @nicolekarlis piece I’m quoted about how most #COVID19 medical countermeasures are available only under EUA and the government is the only buyer and distributor. If there’s no funds to do that and no commercial market, it is a severe problem  https://t.co/opaLj4eVBg

In this @daxe piece I’m quoted about the failed #COVID19 zero policy in China and the Chinese government’s inexplicable failure to approve mRNA vaccines (which they unscientifically have cast aspersions on) https://t.co/kfDnu8hfgy

In this @CassMorrison94 piece I’m quoted about how it’s not surprising to see #COVID19 cases going up in Europe — the virus is always going to be with us and have ups/downs. The key is focusing on hospitalizations, not cases https://t.co/2ogBgQpd8C
